intro: Lycianthes variifolia, commonly known as the variable physalis, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its vibrant, lantern-shaped fruits that enclose its seeds. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are usually yellow with five petals. The fruit, which turns red when mature, is edible and has a tangy, citrus-like flavor.
